title: Randomprime API
description: Input format for randomprime's JSON API. The JSON schema can be found [here](https://toasterparty.github.io/randomprime/randomprime.schema.json).

$schema.description: The URL of the JSON schema. Typically `https://toasterparty.github.io/randomprime/randomprime.schema.json`.

runMode.description: Sets the output mode of randomprime.

logbookFilename.description: The filepath to write the output from the `ExportLogbook` run mode.

inputIso.description: The filepath of the ISO to be patched.

outputIso.description: The filepath of the ISO after patching.

forceVanillaLayout.description: If true prevent the patcher from defaulting pickups to `Nothing` items. Also changes the default of many options to be more vanilla-like.

externAssetsDir.description: The directory path for custom assets (e.g. Echoes pickup models) to be used during patching.

uuid.description: Specify a UUID to "etch" into the ISO. It gets placed somewhere around the build version #

strg.description: Replace the contents of the specified STRG asset id. STRG are text 'table' files that typically follows the following format: [<initial text>, <logbook category>, <logbook entry>]

preferences.description: User-preference options like default in-game options, suit colors, Fusion Suit, and more.

defaultGameOptions.description: Default values for in-game options used when a new save file is created

skipSplashScreens.description: Whether or not the Nintendo, Retro Studios, and Dolby splash screens are shown before the title screen.

suitColors.description: Change the colors of the in-game suits by rotating their values along the color wheel. (This currently does not apply to Fusion Suit)

forceFusion.description: If true, force fusion suit to be enabled by default and stay on after system resets

cacheDir.description: Path to a directory which randomprime can use to cache a copies of suit color rotations.

qolGeneral.description: Non-critical fixes and improvements to the base game such as fixed sound effects and removed tutorial popups

qolGameBreaking.description: Fixe crashes, softlocks, undo non-NTSC sequence break patches and more.

qolCosmetic.description:
- Remove all of the item aquisition cutscenes (e.g. Space Jump)
- Remove all but 1 of the file select background videos so that during races, everyone spawns into the game at the same RTA
- Remove all but 1 of the attract videos to make copying the game to your wii faster
- Skip item acquisition pop-up message
- Make the morph ball and missile HUD says `X/Y` instead of just `X`

qolCutscenes.description:
Changes made to in-game cutscenes.
- `Original`: No changes to cutscenes are made.
- `Competitive`: Similar to Minor but leaves a few rooms alone where skipping cutscenes would be inappropriate for races.
- `Skippable`: Keeps all of the cutscenes in the game, but makes it so that they can be skipped with the START button.
- `SkippableCompetitive`: Similar to skippable, but removes some cutscenes from the game which hinder the flow of competitive play. All others are skippable.
- `Minor (Deprecated)`: Removes cutscenes that don't affect the game very much when removed.
- `Major (Deprecated)`: Allows you to continue playing the game while cutscenes happen.

qolPickupScans.description: Rewrites some scan point text which would otherwise obscure a pickup's identity. Also adds scans where pickups are normally visible but not scannable.

mapDefaultState.description: Define the default behavior regarding when/how rooms are displayed on the map.

artifactHintBehavior.description:
Set the state of Artifact Temple's hint totems and how they displays hints.
`All`: Allow all hint scans to be collected immediately.
- `None`: Do not allow hint scans to be collected at all.
`Default`: Allow only certain hints to be scanned until more artifacts are collected.

automaticCrashScreen.description: If true, the debug crash screen is displayed immediately instead of requiring a controller input from the Player 2 controller port.

visibleBoundingBox.description: If true, the corners of aether boxes are outlined to be visible in-game.

trilogyDiscPath.description: The filepath to a Trilogy ISO to restore the intended Flaahgra music.

quickplay.description: Skip the file select screen and start the game directly in the starting room. Useful for testing.

quickpatch.description: Removes all video and audio tracks from the ISO. Useful for testing game changes.

quiet.description: Suppresses all standard output from randomprime in the console/terminal window.

gameConfig.description: Configuration options affecting the player, their starting equipment, the game world, suit properties, and more.

difficultyBehavior.description:
Control how difficulty options are presented tot he player.
- `Either`: The player can choose between Normal and Hard difficulty
- `NormalOnly`: The player is forced to pick Normal difficulty
- `HardOnly`: The player is forced to pick Hard difficulty

startingRoom.description: The room in which the player will spawn when starting the game from a new save file.

startingMemo.description: A text box displayed at the start of the game to convey information to they player like starting items or a message to the player.

springBall.description: Restores the Spring Ball feature from Metroid Prime Trilogy. Use C-Stick Up while being morphed to use Spring Ball. NOTE: You need Morph Ball Bombs to use Spring Ball just like in Metroid Prime Trilogy.

warpToStart.description: Refusing to save at any Save Station while holding L + R will warp you to the starting location (by default, Samus' Ship in Tallon Overworld: Landing Site)

warpToStartDelayS.description: The delay, in seconds, before the player is warped to their starting location when using the feature at a Save Station. Using a value lower than 3 will very likely cause crashing and is not recommended.

shufflePickupPosition.description: Item locations are randomized within the aether box of the rooms they reside in. There is no checking to ensure items are placed inbounds, so seeds are not guaranteed to be logical or even completable. Item scan points are adjusted in this mode to be larger and can be seen through walls.

shufflePickupPosAllRooms.description: [Deprecated] Adds pickups to rooms which normally have none at random positions.

removeVanillaBlastShields.description: Removes all blast shields from all doors that have them in the vanilla game.

nonvariaHeatDamage.description: Removes heat protection from Gravity Suit and Phazon Suit, giving more usefulness to the Varia Suit pickup.

staggeredSuitDamage.description: Damage reduction depends on how many suits you have, not which.

heatDamagePerSec.description: Configure how much damage per second you take in heated rooms when you don't have the proper protection.

poisonDamagePerSec.description: Configure how much damage per second you take in poison water.

phazonDamagePerSec.description: Configure how much damage per second you take in Phazon. NOTE: By default, this value scales exponentially over time. Use phazonDamageModifier to change this if you wish to greatly raise the damage value and have the player survive for >1 second.

phazonDamageModifier.description:
Configure how the damage value for Phazon is calculated.
- `Default`: Exponential damage per second.
- `Linear`: Consistent damager per second.
- `Linear_Delayed` - Unknown

autoEnabledElevators.description: Whether or not the region elevators start active without the need of Scan Visor to activate the holograms. This settings does not affect the elevators within rooms of a region, like the elevators to/from Control Tower in Phendrana Drifts.

skipRidley.description: An option to skip the Ridley fight in Artifact Temple once all the Artifacts have been collected, providing immediate access to the Impact Crater teleporter.

multiworldDolPatches.description: Apply patches to replace the hint state logic with logic needed for Randovania's multiworld functionality.

startingItems.description: The items with which the player starts the game.

itemLossItems.description: The items the player has after the item loss sequence, if enabled.

disableItemLoss.description: Controls or not the player experiences item loss from the Connection Elevator to Deck Alpha cutscene.

startingVisor.description: Visor which is open when the player spawns viewing, regardless of if they have the corresponding item. Also the visor which the player unmorphs into. Defaults to the first included item specified in startingItems in order of: Combat, Thermal, XRay, and Scan.

startingBeam.description: Beam which the player starts the game holding, regardless if they have the corresponding item. Defaults to the first item specified in startingItems in order of: Power, Plasma, Ice, Wave.

shootInGrapple.description: If true, lets the player use their arm cannon while swinging with Grapple Beam. Note that there is a minor visual bug when beam combos are used.

escapeSequenceCountsUp.description: Modifies escape sequence timers such as the one in Frigate Orpheon to count up instead of down.

enableIceTraps.description: Set to true if Ice Traps items are used in this layout.

missileStationPbRefill.description: If enabled, Missile Stations also refill Power Bomb ammunition.

doorOpenMode.description:
Affects door behavior when a blast shield is destroyed.
- `Original`: Doors always stay the same color after opening.
- `PrimaryBlastShield`: Doors under blast shields downgrade their vulnerability to Blue/Wave/Ice/Plasma from vulnerabilities with more requirements after opening.
- `BlueBlastShield`: Doors under blast shields downgrade to Blue doors after opening.

etankCapacity.description: The amount of energy provided by an Energy Tank.

itemMaxCapacity.description: The maximum capacity which a player can have of an item.

phazonEliteWithoutDynamo.description: Removes the Central Dynamo item requirement for activating the Phazon Elite boss fight.

mainPlazaDoor.description: Allows acess to Vault from Main Plaza.

backwardsLabs.description: Scan through barrier of Research Lab Hydra when approached from behind.

backwardsFrigate.description: Power door in Main Ventilation Shaft Section B when approached from behind.

backwardsUpperMines.description: Disable Main Quarry barrier automatically when approached from Mine Security Station.

backwardsLowerMines.description: Remove PCA locks and allow passing through lower mines scan barriers from the back.

patchPowerConduits.description: Decrease conduit health from 5.0 to 1.0, allowing activation even if 1 out of 3 Wave shots hit.

removeMineSecurityStationLocks.description: Remove the locks from Mine Security Station, allowing the player to leave without completing the fight encounter.

removeHiveMecha.description: Remove the trigger that initiates the Hive Mecha miniboss fight.

powerBombArboretumSandstone.description: Modifies the Sandstone block in Arboretum on the path to Flaahgra to be weak to power bombs.

incineratorDroneConfig.description: Replace the 'random add' timer values us in the Incinerator Drone miniboss fight with constants.

mazeSeeds.description: Set the seed of the maze in Central Dynamo. Note that this exposes mazes not normally accessible in vanilla. Most mazes are bad, so be sure to test in-game.

hallOfTheEldersBombSlotCovers.description: Changes the vulnerabilities to the shields covering the bomb slots in Hall of the Elders.

gameBanner.description: Change the game information displayed by emulators/loaders.

mainMenuMessage.description: Message text displayed inthe bottom-right of the file select menu.

creditsString.description: Defaults to an auto-generated spoiler of all local pickups.

resultsString.description: The message displayed on the mission complete screen at the end of the game.

artifactHints.description: The hint provided to the player when scanning the respective Artifact's totem in Artifact Temple. Supports color modification with &push and &pop delimiters. If left unspecified, defaults to humorous hints which include the room name of the corresponding artifact.

artifactTempleLayerOverrides.description: Override layer(s) in Artifact Temple to remove Artifact it's collection requirement(s). If unspecified, these layers are set only if the Artifact is not placed anywhere in `levelData`.

requiredArtifactCount.description:
Set the number of totems which need to be activated for the ridley fight to be triggered. Totems can be activated by:
1. Collecting the artifact corresponding to the totem
2. Excluding the artifact from `levelData`
3.`artifactTempleLayerOverrides` is set to `true` for the artifact corresponding to the totem

noDoors.description: Option to remove doors and let the player walk directly through the dock to the next room. Can be dangerous if the next room has not finished loading.

bossSizes.description: Modifiers to the size of bosses and minibosses. Settings this value too high or low can render the encounter impossible.

legacyBlockSize.description: [Deprecated] If true, block sizes will be the same size that the were in v1.19.2 and earlier. This is the equivalent of multiplying all block scale values by 1.7036

tweaks.description: Change the value of various CTWK values found in `Tweaks.Pak`. Many of these values are either relative or multiplicative to the default values.

addModifyId.description: The instance ID to use for this object. If the provided ID matches an existing object, the existing object will be modified. Otherwise, a new object will be added.

addModifyLayer.description: The layer # to use for this object. Defaults to 0 unless ID matches an existing object in which case the layer is unchanged.

room.description: Patches for modifying the contents of a specific room.

doors.description: Patches for modifying the behavior of doors within a room. In this object, doors are specified by their `Dock Number`. See <TODO> for a map of all Dock Numbers in the game.

shieldType.description: Choose the "door color" for this door. This replaces the glowing shield actor and updates it's damage vulnerability to match. Defaults to vanilla if unspecified.

blastShieldType.description: Choose the "shield" to go over this door and it's vulnerability. Picking `None` will remove the vanilla blast shield if it exists and picking `Unchanged` will change nothing from vanilla.

destination.description: Re-route this door to move the player to a different room instead of the room typically adjacent to this door. This works best when connections are specified bi-directionally, but it is not strictly requried. The mini-map does not update to reflect these changes at this time.

roomName.description: Name of a room in this same region which this door should connect to

dockNum.description: The dock number in the destination room which to connect to.

pickups.description: Modify or add pickups in this room. If the length of this array is greater than the number of pickups found in the room normally, additional pickups will be added to the room. Note that additional pickups require a `position`.

id.description: The instance ID to use for this pickup. Only used if this is an "additional" pickup.

type.description: Defines what is acquired when the pickup is obtained.

scanText.description: The text displayed to the user when the pickup is scanned. Defaults to the pickup `type`.

hudmemoText.description: The text displayed to the user when the pickup is obtained. Defaults to `type acquired!`.

maxIncrease.description: The amount which the player's inventory capacity for this item increases when the pickup is obtained. Defaults to `1`, except for `Missile`, which defaults to `5`.

currIncrease.description: The amount of missiles/energy that this pickup refills. Defaults to `maxIncrease`.

respawn.description: If true, this pickup will respawn every time the room is reloaded.

model.description: The model which is displayed in-game. Defaults to the pickup `type` or an item closely related. Note that the available models can be expanded by specifying an `externAssetsDir` with additional model assets.

position.description: The `[X, Y, Z]` coordinates of the pickup. Required for any number of pickups beyond what is found in the vanilla room.

modalHudmemo.description: If true, show a pop-up dialog to display the `hudmemoText` for 3 seconds before it can be dismissed with the A Button.

jumboScan.description: If true, modify the pickup's scan point to be larger and scannable through terrain.

destination.description: Teleports the player to the specified room when the pickup is obtained.

showIcon.description: If true, marks the pickup location with a white dot on the map

superheated.description: If true, makes the room superheated while the player does not have Varia

removeWater.description: If true, removes all water/lava in the room, excluding volumes added by `liquids` and `submerge`.

submerge.description: If true, adds a water box the size of the room's bounding box, thus fully submerging the room in water.

liquids.description: Add liquid volumes to this room.

type.description: Define what kind of liquid. Note that Phazon water is unused in the base game and acts similarly to Phazon pools.

position.description: Point at which the liquid is centerd.

scale.description: The extent of the liquid volume.

mapDefaultState.description: Define this room's behavior regarding when/how it is displayed on the map.

extraScans.description: Add scan points to this room.

id.description: The instance ID to use for this scan point. Useful for activating objects on SCAN_DONE.

combatVisible.description: If true, places a "Elevator Scan" actor over the scan point so it visible in all visors.

rotation.description: Rotation of the scan point. This is only needed if `combatVisible: true`.

isRed.description: If true, this scan point is *important* and will be displayed with the red scan icon instead of the normal yellow.

logbookTitle.description: Title to display in the logbook for this research entry.

logbookCategory.description: Which logbook category to file this research entry under.

spawnPositionOverride.description: Moves the default spawn of this room to the provided position. This is used when starting a new game, and when taking an elevator to this room.

boundingBoxOffset.description: Offset the bounding box used for physics calculations in any direction. This effectly moves aether walls and ceilings.

boundingBoxScale.description: Scale the bounding box extent to be larger/smaller in any direction.

cameraHints.description: Add camera hint + camera hint trigger pairs to this room. They are somewhat broken.

cameraRot.description: Facing angle of the Camera Hint.

blocks.description: Add blocks to this room. They are specifically the sandstone blocks found in Ruined nursery as they are the closest thing to a 1x1x1 perfect square as I could find.

id.description: The instance ID to use for this block. Cannot be already in use by any other object in this room.

active.description: Default active state of the block.

scale.description: Extent of the block. While it is close, it should be noted this is not exactly 1:1 with game units.

texture.description: Texture to use across the block's surface.

lockOnPoints.description: Add lock-on/grapple points to this room.

isGrapple.description: If true, adds grapple functionality to this point.

noLock.description: [Deprecated] If true, removes the ability to lock on, making this just a point.

id1.description: Instance ID of the actor object. Defaults to next unused ID.

id2.description: Instance ID of the lock-on target. Defaults to next unused ID.

active1.description: Set to false to disable the actor by default.

active2.description: Set to false to disable the lock-on target by default.

fog.description: Edit the ambient fog settings for this room.

color.description: RGBA fog color for this room.

range.description: X and Y axis ranges for the fog of this room.

ambientLightingScale.description: Scale the ambient brightness of this room up or down. This mostly affects areas of the room which have no nearby light sources.

escapeSequences.description: Adds a pair of triggers to start/stop an escape sequence timer. Note that the escape sequence timers can be modified to count up in `gameConfig`.

time.description: Time in seconds with which to initialize the escape sequence counter with.

startTriggerPos.description: Position to place the start trigger.

stopTriggerPos.description: Position to place the stop trigger. If you don't want a stop trigger, just place this at Z -1000.

repositions.description: Add triggers to this room which teleport the player to a specific location when entered.

destinationPosition.description: Position to send the player to when the trigger is entered.

destinationRotation.description: Facing angle of the player when they are repositioned.

hudmemos.description: Add hudmemos to this room. These are used to display text to the player.

active.description: Default active state of the hudmemo.

text.description: Message to display to the player

modal.description: Determines whether or not a popup box is used

deleteIds.description: List of Instance IDs (in decimal form) to remove from this room.

layers.description: Modify the starting state of any layer for this room

^(?:[0-9]|[1-5][0-9]|6[0-3])$.description: Whether or not this layer starts enabled

layerObjs.description:
Deprecated, use `objects.layer` instead.
Move objects in this room to a different layer by instance ID. If the specified layer does not exist, it will be created.

editObjs.description: Modify properties of existing objects by their instance ID. Only generic properties shared across many object types can be edited such as position/scale. Not all objects support all properties. In these cases, an error is thrown when patching the ISO.

layer.description: Layer # to move this object to. If the specified layer does not exist, it will be created.

rotation.description: Rotation of the object in degrees.

size.description: Relative size of the object as defined in it's `PatternedAITypedef`

damage.description: Relative damage of the object as defined across it's `PatternedAITypedef` and/or `DamageInfo` structs.

speed.description: Relative speed of the object as defined in it's `PatternedAITypedef`

detectionRange.description: Relative detection range of the object as defined in it's `PatternedAITypedef`

attackRange.description: Relative attack range of the object as defined in it's `PatternedAITypedef`

vulnerability.description: Sets all vulnerabilities of this object with the value specified here.

vulnerabilities.description: Replace one or more vulnerabilities of this object. Vulnerabilities are indexed in the order which they appear in PWE starting at 0.

health.description: Adjust the amount of health of this object.

healths.description: Adjust the amount of health of specific components of this object. Healths are indexed in the order which they appear in PWE starting at 0.

audioOverride.description: [Deprecated] Replace audio file(s) specified by existing StreamedAudio objects in this room. Use `streamedAudios` instead.

^[0-9]+$.description: The filename(s) of the new audio file. Example: `/audio/min_phazonL.dsp|/audio/min_phazonR.dsp`.

addConnections.description: Add additional connections between objects in this room.

removeConnections.description: Remove connections between objects in this room.

active.description: Default active state of the relay.
Default active state of the timer.

maxRandomAdd.description: Used apply random offset to the timer each time it resets.

looping.description: If true, this timer restarts itself every time it expires.

startImmediately.description: If true, this timer starts the frame the room finishes loading.

spawnPoints.description: Add spawn points to this room.

active.description: Default active state of the spawn point.

position.description: Position which the player should spawn.

rotation.description: Orientation which the player should spawn. It appears that only the Z value matters (0-360).

defaultSpawn.description: Sets whether this spawn point is to be used as the default for this room. Default spawn points are used when starting a new game and using teleporters.

morphed.description: If true, the player will spawn morphed when repositioned to this spawn point.

items.description:
Inventory which the player will start with if:
A - The player starts a new game in this room and this spawn point is the only default spawn point.
B - This spawn point receives a `RESET` message from another object.

active.description: Default activate state of the trigger

force.description: If the apply force flag is enabled, this is the force applied.

damageType.description: If the `damageAmount` is non-zero this is the type of damage which is applied.

flags.description: Defines various attributes of the trigger. Use PWE on any existing trigger to calculate this as a number.

specialFunctions.description: Add special functions to this room. These do vastly different things based on the `type`.

streamedAudios.description: Add streamed audio objects to this room. Useful for playing music or musical stings.

waypoints.description: Add/modifgy waypoints in this room. Useful for defining paths of enemies, cameras etc.

active.description: Default active state of the waypoint.
Default active state of the counter.

maxValue.description: Max value of the counter at which the `MAX_REACHED` state is reached.

autoReset.description: If true, the counter will automatically revert to `startValue` when `MAX_REACHED`.

active.description: Default active state of the switch.

open.description: If true, the initial state of the switch will be `OPEN`

autoClose.description: If true, the switch will automatically revert to `CLOSED` when used.

playerHints.description: Add/modify PlayerHints to this room. These are most often used to disable or partially disable the player's control.

active.description: Default active state of the playerhint.

enum: Chozo Ruins:Transport to Magmoor Caverns North
Chozo Ruins:Transport to Tallon Overworld East
Chozo Ruins:Transport to Tallon Overworld North
Chozo Ruins:Transport to Tallon Overworld South
Frigate Orpheon:Cargo Freight Lift to Deck Gamma
Frigate Orpheon:Connection Elevator to Deck Alpha
Frigate Orpheon:Connection Elevator to Deck Beta
Frigate Orpheon:Connection Elevator to Deck Beta (1)
Frigate Orpheon:Main Ventilation Shaft Section A
Frigate Orpheon:Main Ventilation Shaft Section B
Frigate Orpheon:Main Ventilation Shaft Section C
Frigate Orpheon:Main Ventilation Shaft Section D
Frigate Orpheon:Main Ventilation Shaft Section E
Frigate Orpheon:Main Ventilation Shaft Section F
Magmoor Caverns:Transport to Chozo Ruins North
Magmoor Caverns:Transport to Phazon Mines West
Magmoor Caverns:Transport to Phendrana Drifts North
Magmoor Caverns:Transport to Phendrana Drifts South
Magmoor Caverns:Transport to Tallon Overworld West
Phazon Mines:Transport to Magmoor Caverns South
Phazon Mines:Transport to Tallon Overworld South
Phendrana Drifts:Transport to Magmoor Caverns South
Phendrana Drifts:Transport to Magmoor Caverns West
Tallon Overworld:Cargo Freight Lift to Deck Gamma
Tallon Overworld:Connection Elevator to Deck Beta
Tallon Overworld:Main Ventilation Shaft Section A
Tallon Overworld:Main Ventilation Shaft Section B
Tallon Overworld:Main Ventilation Shaft Section C
Tallon Overworld:Transport to Chozo Ruins East
Tallon Overworld:Transport to Chozo Ruins South
Tallon Overworld:Transport to Chozo Ruins West
Tallon Overworld:Transport to Magmoor Caverns East
Tallon Overworld:Transport to Phazon Mines East
Tallon Overworld South (Great Tree Hall, Upper)
Tallon Overworld South (Great Tree Hall, Lower)
Chozo Ruins East (Reflecting Pool, Save Station)
Chozo Ruins South (Reflecting Pool, Far End)
Magmoor Caverns South (Magmoor Workstation, Save Station)

senderId.description: Instance ID of the object which contains the connection.

targetId.description: Instance ID of the object which the message is to be sent to.

state.description: Object state which to send the message when reached.
